definitions: not yet identified or determined as a specific medical condition through examination
examples: The undiagnosed illness left doctors puzzled for months
Many patients suffer from undiagnosed conditions for years

definitions: not distinguished or differentiated from others; lacking distinctive characteristics
having the same structure throughout without specialized parts or cells
examples: The company offered undifferentiated products in a competitive market
Their undifferentiated approach failed to attract customers
The undifferentiated cells could develop into any tissue type
Early embryos contain mostly undifferentiated cellular material

definitions: without specific direction, guidance, or purposeful control from an authority
not aimed or pointed toward a particular target or goal
examples: The undirected students wandered aimlessly through their coursework
His undirected energy needed proper channeling and focus
Their undirected efforts produced little meaningful progress or results
The undirected search yielded random and unhelpful information

definitions: lacking the ability to control one's behavior or follow rules and standards
examples: The undisciplined troops ignored their commanding officer's orders
Her undisciplined spending habits led to serious debt

definitions: not made known or public; kept secret or confidential from disclosure
examples: The company sold for an undisclosed amount last month
Sources close to the undisclosed location confirmed the meeting

definitions: not yet found, detected, or noticed; remaining hidden or unknown to people
examples: The undiscovered talent waited years for recognition and success
Many undiscovered species live in remote rainforest regions

definitions: not questioned, challenged, or doubted; accepted by everyone as true or valid
examples: She remains the undisputed champion after ten successful title defenses
His undisputed authority made all decisions final and binding

definitions: lacking distinction or excellence; mediocre and not notable in any way
examples: His undistinguished career ended without any major achievements
The undistinguished building blended into the urban landscape

definitions: not interrupted, bothered, or interfered with by outside forces or people
remaining in the original position or condition without being moved or altered
examples: She worked undisturbed in her quiet home office all morning
The undisturbed peace lasted throughout the meditation session
The undisturbed archaeological site preserved ancient artifacts perfectly
Layers of undisturbed sediment revealed geological history clearly

definitions: complete and total without any part held back or given elsewhere
not split, separated, or divided into parts; remaining whole
examples: She gave him her undivided attention during the meeting
The issue deserves our undivided focus and commitment
The undivided property remained in the family for generations
They maintained undivided ownership of the business venture

definitions: lacking official papers, especially legal immigration or identification documents
not recorded, described, or supported by written documentation or evidence
examples: Undocumented workers often face exploitation and legal challenges
The undocumented immigrants sought legal assistance and protection
The software contained undocumented features discovered by users
Much undocumented history was preserved through oral traditions

definitions: not completed, finished, or accomplished; left incomplete or unfinished
unfastened, untied, or loosened from a previously secured state
examples: Important work remained undone despite the approaching deadline
The undone tasks accumulated into an overwhelming backlog
Her shirt came undone during the vigorous dance performance
The carefully tied knots became undone in the storm

definitions: not wearing clothes; naked or partially clothed state of a person
not prepared, treated, or finished with dressing or decorative covering
examples: He felt uncomfortable being undressed during the medical examination
She quickly got undressed and jumped into the shower
The undressed salad needed oil and vinegar before serving
The undressed wound required immediate cleaning and bandaging

definitions: excessive, inappropriate, or more than is necessary, proper, or normal
examples: The contract placed undue burden on small business owners
She complained about undue influence in the selection process

definitions: lasting forever; eternal and never ending, especially regarding emotions or qualities
examples: He declared his undying love for her at the wedding
She earned their undying gratitude through her selfless actions

definitions: not deserved, merited, or worked for; obtained without effort or justification
examples: His unearned wealth came entirely from family inheritance
The team benefited from an unearned advantage over opponents

definitions: seeming not to belong to this world; supernatural, mysterious, or eerily strange
unreasonably early or late; occurring at an inappropriate or unusual time
examples: An unearthly glow emanated from the mysterious cave entrance
The unearthly silence made everyone feel deeply uncomfortable
She called at an unearthly hour disturbing everyone's sleep
They started their journey at an unearthly time before dawn

definitions: feeling anxious, worried, or uncomfortable about something uncertain or threatening
examples: She felt uneasy about walking alone after dark
An uneasy silence fell over the crowded room

definitions: not profitable or economically viable; costing more than the value produced
examples: The uneconomic factory finally closed after years of losses
Mining became uneconomic when commodity prices dropped significantly

definitions: not revised, corrected, or prepared for publication; in original raw form
examples: The unedited manuscript contained numerous spelling and grammar errors
She posted unedited photos showing her natural appearance

definitions: lacking formal education or schooling; not having received systematic instruction
examples: The uneducated population struggled to find well-paying employment
His uneducated guess turned out surprisingly accurate

definitions: not having paid work but available to work and actively seeking employment
examples: The unemployed workers protested outside the closed factory
She remained unemployed for six months after graduation

definitions: not having any burdens, obligations, or impediments that restrict freedom or progress
examples: She enjoyed the unencumbered lifestyle of a digital nomad
The property was sold unencumbered by any liens or mortgages

definitions: continuing without stopping or coming to an end; seeming to last forever
examples: The refugees faced an unending stream of challenges and hardships
Her unending enthusiasm inspired everyone on the team

definitions: not capable of being enforced or compelled, especially regarding laws or contracts
examples: The contract contained several unenforceable clauses under state law
Such vague regulations proved unenforceable in practice

definitions: showing little or no enthusiasm, interest, or excitement about something
examples: The audience gave an unenthusiastic response to the performance
His unenthusiastic attitude affected team morale negatively

definitions: not the same in quantity, size, value, or degree between things compared
unfairly different in status, rights, or opportunities between people or groups
examples: The cake was cut into unequal pieces causing arguments
The unequal distribution of resources created serious problems
The unequal treatment of employees led to discrimination lawsuits
Society struggles with unequal access to quality education

definitions: leaving no doubt or room for misunderstanding; absolutely clear and unambiguous
examples: The board gave their unequivocal support to the proposal
Her unequivocal statement left no room for interpretation

definitions: not conforming to accepted standards of moral or professional conduct
examples: The unethical business practices led to criminal investigations
Doctors who perform unethical experiments lose their medical licenses

definitions: not level, flat, or smooth; having an irregular or bumpy surface
varying in quality, rate, or distribution; inconsistent or irregular
examples: The uneven pavement made walking difficult for elderly residents
She applied makeup to cover her uneven skin tone
The movie received uneven reviews from critics and audiences
His uneven performance throughout the season disappointed fans

definitions: marked by no noteworthy, interesting, or exciting events or incidents
examples: They had an uneventful flight with no delays or turbulence
His uneventful life changed dramatically after winning the lottery

definitions: not expected, anticipated, or predicted; coming as a surprise to someone
examples: The unexpected visitor arrived just as dinner was served
Her unexpected death shocked the entire community deeply

definitions: still valid and not yet reached the expiration date or end of term
examples: She renewed her unexpired passport before the international trip
The unexpired portion of his contract was transferred

definitions: not accounted for, made clear, or provided with an explanation
examples: The unexplained disappearance baffled investigators for years
Several unexplained phenomena were reported near the site

definitions: not yet detonated or exploded but still capable of exploding
examples: The unexploded bomb required careful removal by specialists
They found unexploded ordnance from the war buried underground

definitions: not yet investigated, examined, or traveled through by people
examples: The unexplored territory promised new scientific discoveries
Many unexplored caves contain unique geological formations

definitions: not based on or showing justice, impartiality, or reasonable treatment
examples: The unfair decision favored wealthy students over others
She complained about the unfair distribution of work

definitions: engaging in sexual relations with someone other than one's partner
not true to the original; inaccurate or unreliable in representation
examples: Her unfaithful husband destroyed their marriage through betrayal
The unfaithful partner sought forgiveness after confessing
The unfaithful translation distorted the author's original meaning
His unfaithful memory produced an inaccurate account

definitions: not known or recognized; not having knowledge or experience of something
examples: The unfamiliar surroundings made her feel anxious and lost
He struggled with unfamiliar technical terminology in class

definitions: not following or reflecting current fashion trends or popular styles
examples: Her unfashionable clothes attracted unwanted attention at school
The once-trendy neighborhood became unfashionable and neglected

definitions: not giving or indicating advantage, approval, or a positive outcome
examples: The unfavorable weather conditions forced flight cancellations
Critics gave mostly unfavorable reviews of the performance

definitions: not possible to do or carry out; impractical or unworkable
examples: The proposed timeline proved unfeasible given resource constraints
Building there was unfeasible due to environmental regulations

definitions: not restricted or controlled; free from restraint or inhibition
examples: The constitution guarantees unfettered access to information
Her unfettered imagination produced remarkably creative stories

definitions: not filled, occupied, or supplied with what is needed or required
examples: Several unfilled positions remained open despite extensive recruiting
The unfilled orders accumulated during the supply shortage

definitions: not completed or brought to an end; lacking final details or polish
examples: The unfinished project haunted him for years afterward
She left several unfinished paintings in her studio

definitions: not suitable, qualified, or competent for a particular purpose or position
not in good physical condition; lacking adequate fitness or health
examples: The court declared him unfit to stand trial
The contaminated water was unfit for human consumption
Years of inactivity left him unfit and overweight
The unfit recruits struggled with basic training exercises

definitions: making someone or something appear unattractive or show negative qualities
examples: The unflattering photograph showed every wrinkle and blemish
She wore an unflattering dress that emphasized her worst features

definitions: showing no fear or hesitation in the face of danger or difficulty
examples: Her unflinching courage inspired others during the crisis
He maintained unflinching eye contact throughout the interrogation

definitions: lacking clear direction, purpose, or concentration in thought or action
not adjusted for clear vision; blurred or not sharply defined
examples: His unfocused approach to studying produced poor results
The unfocused meeting wandered through various unrelated topics
The unfocused image needed adjustment for clarity
Her unfocused eyes suggested she wasn't paying attention

definitions: happening naturally without pressure or artificial effort; genuine and spontaneous
examples: Her unforced laughter filled the room with genuine joy
The conversation flowed with unforced ease between old friends
